body.description: Improve cooling and airflow to your case/system with this Apevia 80mm x 80mm x 25mm black silent case fan. It offers incredible cooling and abundant airflow to increase the longevity and stability of the system and components. Super quiet and powerful, ideal for PC cooling.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 360 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as advertised
reviews.reviewText: Used these while making some retro arcade cabinets for my family. They're not silent at all but not terribly noisy. The sounds of video games is easily 100x louder than the fans. Moves enough air that everything was running cool. CPU maxed out at 51°C and the rest was basically room temperature.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good for price
reviews.reviewText: They are fans. Not a huge amount of air, but cheap enough that for my application I could use in large numbers. Connectors vary from batch to batch. I think I bought about 120 total with maybe 1 failure

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars For the three minutes I ran them, they seemed fine . . . .
reviews.reviewText: Started out needing to replace a noisy fan. And since I didn't want to repeat this process any time soon, I figured on replacing all of them at once.Wasn't expecting much for the price, but these fans were pretty quiet. And not a surprise, they don't seem to move a lot of air, but with a large PS fan, a good sized heat sink fan, and these new fans as well, my very overcrowded tower case seemed in good shape, and WAY less noisy than before. However, as I was buttoning up the case, I moved one of the new fan's power leads a bit, so it wouldn't get pinched, and got a large Snap of an electrical arc, followed by total silence. I blew my power supply.In looking into the issue, I realized that each of these new fans has both the 3-pin connector and a 4-pin Molex connector. That's good. However, the Molex connector is 2 sided. It has both male and female pins. So whichever type you use, there are exposed pins on the unused side. One of these exposed pins found something to connect to and cost me a new power supply. At the minimum. Just ordered one. Not a happy customer, but I assure you, I will tape the living hell out of those unused, exposed fan connectors when I rebuild it. At least a full day of un-needed headaches, if the thing even wakes up again, and another $75 for a new P/S, all for some budget fans.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Happy with my order
reviews.reviewText: They work great. I add fans to several systems both in 80MM and 120MM. These are a great up-sell on most systems. 4 pin Molex power, and 4 pin mother board connection available on every fan. Air flow clearly marked on the fan.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent 80mm PC case fans.
reviews.reviewText: Excellent 80mm PC case fans. The fans are quiet and efficiently removes heat from inside my computer case. I have one blowing hot air out the back vent and one blowing cool air in the side vent. This setup works best for me and keeps my PC cool. They can be powered using the 3 pin on the motherboard or the molex plug from the PSU. Each fan comes with 4 mounting screws. The 5 pack is very good value for these quality fans. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase and would recommend them to my family and friends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cheap quiet fans. Connectors leave a bit to be desired but are useable
reviews.reviewText: Honestly not a whole lot to say. They are cheap case fans. They are quiet (much quieter than the worn out ones they replaced that sounded like a can of rocks inside of a tire on a bumpy country road).The only negative I felt was the connectors. The pins were not straight and caused a bit of a headache to plug into the PSU molex connectors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not nearly as much airflow as the Arctic F8
reviews.reviewText: I ordered a bunch of fans (Cooler Master 140mm, Rosewill 120mm, APEVIA AF58S-BK 80mm, and Arctic F8 80mm) to see which ones would give me the best airflow, and by FAR the Arctic F8 80mm fan *blew them all out of the water.*I was surprised despite similar design and larger size of other fans. I'm using them for hobby purposes and don't care as much about sound, but they were all pretty quiet (probably proportional with the amount of air they were moving (meaning the Arctic was louder at 12V, but the Arctic at 5V, was as quiet and moving as much air as the others at 12V).I know that it wasn't a super scientific test and they weren't even the same size, but it wasn't even close. Really surprised me actually.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2022
